name: Nancy S.
review:
Not happy to give this place a poor review. I love Thai food and know what it's supposed to taste like. The only good thing is food is prepared quickly. But the way they've cut corners on their dishes has unfortunately really, really impacted the quality of their food.

Drunken noodle - Taste was so off. I noticed color looked a little weird, thought nothing of it. But I couldn't taste the palm sugar or oyster sauce or anything that usually goes into pad kee mao. Noodles had been overcooked and no longer chewy, only disintegrated in your mouth with an unpleasant texture. Veggies cut poorly (chunky), seemed more appropriate for a stir fry. Because of this, some of them were cooked unevenly. Not a good order.

Mango sticky rice - it's hard to mess this up, but this could also be improved. Mango was nice, but this was the blandest mango sticky rice I've ever had. I'm pretty sure they only used coconut milk to top the rice, and maybe cooked the glutinous rice with some minor sweetener. Mango was nice and ripe but I feel the rest of the dish was lacking in support.

Just a really disappointing experience with Thai Basil here. To me, this is another symptom of a restaurant located in a college town. There are many other thai places in the area that I'll explore instead.

name: Fred C.
review: The food and portion size was delicious and large. Service was welcoming, prompt and courteous. Wonderful for lunch

name: Le T.
review:
The restaurant had a very welcoming vibe with nice thai decorations. The server was friendly and attentive.

My fiancé and I ordered the beef salad, bbq chicken, shrimp and tofu pad thai. The beef salad was very flavorful with a large serving amount of beef. The bbq chicken was. delicious with the sauce.

The pad thai was a little on the bitter side. The pad thai was not my favorite dish but everything else was delicious.

name: Dalila V.
review: Great for takeout! I ordered over the phone and my food was ready exactly at the time they said it would be and everything was exactly as I ordered it. The food was pretty good (ordered spring rolls and a curry). The medium spice level is spicy enough where you may want something to wash it down with but not so spicy that it takes away from the flavor. That said I will probably order the mild in the future

name: Nicole B.
review: Depending on what you get, Thai Basil can be pretty amazing. My fav dish of theirs is the chicken katsu or chicken curry. Some dishes are more expensive and as a college student, I'm always looking for the biggest bang for my buck. It's best to get takeout from Thai Basil, you will get so much more food. It's a 5/5 for takeout and the dishes i mentioned but of course I have to take the atmosphere into consideration. The restaurant is quite dim and service can be slower if you do order at a busy time. The staff is extremely sweet though and would always love to offer suggestions.

name: Shannon G.
review: The food was good. It was my first time having Thai food. I did enjoy it. The service was very slow, though it seemed like we waited forever to get our order taken, and our food to arrive.

name: Callie P.
review: Supper good. Food was ready pretty fast for a party of 12 people. Thr place was really clean and the staff was friendly l.

name: Juliana L.
review:
I work about a 5-minute walk from Thai Basil, so my coworkers and I frequent this restaurant for takeout.

I love Thai Basil's curry! I prefer green curry, but the yellow curry (pictured) is also excellent. Both the curry flavor and consistency are spot-on with a generous portion.

I enjoy the pad see ew and pad thai as both have rich flavors. However, in general I find the vegetables to be a bit too crunchy/undercooked.

name: Buncha P.
review:
Today I brought a friend for lunch. I ordered a vegetable drunkard with the most delicious vegetable fried rice. I just ate red curry last week, so I have to bring my friends more often.
The service was excellent, especially Jenny. She was really good at serving .

name: Maddie M.
review: The chicken pad thai & thai tea so good! i would just ask for no tofu in the pad thai

name: Saraely O.
review: I love getting the yellow curry or the cashew chicken! You can't go wrong with that!! I brought my team here and they all loved it! We would all come back

name: Vanessa H.
review:
Best location I have tried so far! I put in a pick up order and it was ready when I arrived about 15 minutes later. The food was still hot when I got home about 25 minutes later! I ordered pad Thai, pad see ew, spring rolls and red curry. The pad Thai is the best! I ordered it with chicken and it was delicious. The portion was so large that I only finished half of it. The pad see ew was ordered with tofu for my sister and she enjoyed it! The red curry was ordered with chicken and my boyfriend loved it. It came with white rice. The spring rolls were tasty with the sweet and sour dipping sauce.

They gave us some extra spring rolls I'm pretty sure! And lots of extra dipping sauces. That was a lovely surprise!

Love this place!

name: G C.
review:
Got take out today! So delicious! 10 mins wait. Masuman curry, crying tiger and drunken noodles very good and big portions. You can tell they take pride and time into their food...the potatoes and carrots were cut elegantly.... Staff was so friendly and kind...while we waited... they offered us water and made us feel welcome. There was a cute lil grandma so kind! They smiled as we waited... love it!

I live in Las Cruces NM and it's a food/culture desert only two Thai places are available and only one is edible. You all are so lucky enjoy!!!

name: Gwenyth I.
review: Thai Basil is a Tempe staple! The food is amazing and fresh. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. The facility is also kept up nicely and clean. I've been going here for years and have no complaints.

name: Wisdom S.
review: Very fresh, very healthy, very satisfying! And the service is outstanding! My favorite dish is the drunken noodles. A must have!

name: Justice E.
review: Made me feel bad for being allergic to something and had to send it back , even offered to pay for it and still was rude.

name: Kelly T.
review: This place has the best green curry I've ever had in my life. Will forever love this location!!

name: Ali Rose H.
review: My fiancé said his meal was pretty good but the massaman curry with chicken I ordered tasted rancid. I ended up throwing it out.

name: Stephanie H.
review: Service is always hit or miss, I've started doing take out so it's faster. They have really good deals on lunch. I always get the Panang curry with tofu, pad Thai with chicken and pad se ew! Their spice isn't super spicy but it's pretty decent Thai!

name: Kim L.
review: WOW. The panang sweet curry is DELICIOUS it's actually amazing. Definitely recommend. They need to add more chicken, but other than that you should order it cause I'm dying over how good it is!!!

name: Toby D.
review: Under new management and now it's just okay, not as sublimely wonderful as it used to be.

name: Alma D.
review: Love this place!!! So clean The staff is very friendly and the food is be back soon for sure!!

name: Hannah S.
review: Always a great experience!! Ive gone here for years and will continue to. I recommend this place to everyone

name: Alex W.
review:
Tried and true, Thai Basil. We have so many options in Tempe for Thai but I'm fairly set on this location next to ASU (even during the school year). Usually I order online or carry out, and with both options, it's never taken forever! Service is so fast. Anytime I go in for carry out there's always a decent crowd there. I know the lunch specials are amazing for the price just as in general for combo meals.

Usually I order Pad Thai or yellow curry and a side like pot stickers or spring rolls... good for a few meals. I know people can be quite particular for spice level... even on the low end (what I order) it is pretty flavorful and not overtly spicy. Spring rolls are better than the pot stickers. Feels like in the last few years the noodle to meat/veggie ratio has gone up.

name: Lei G.
review: Ordered lunch from Uber Eats. Delivery was great. Got Green Curry with chicken & Spicy Noodles with pork. Both were ordered with medium spicy, but didn't have much flavor/spice. Both dishes came with a spring roll which was tasty. Next time placing an order will order spicier. The highlight was the eggplant in the green curry.
